data.oai_dc:dc: This file includes the data used to analyze: i) the axial scaling of the hydraulic diameter (Dh), the 5th percentile of cell wall reinforcement ((t/b)2), the mean wall thickness of latewood tracheids (CWTLW) and the percent of ray parenchyma (PERPAR), ii) the treatment effect on the axial scaling of the above mentioned functional traits, iii) the functional traits trade-off during ontogeny and under different treatments, iv) the hydraulic efficiency in terms of costs and effects on tree growth. Variables are organized in columns and named with the acronyms described in Table 1 and Table 2. The first two columns identify the tree and the disc respectively. Every row corresponds to the value of an individual ring.
axial scaling|cell wall thickness|elevated CO2|ray parenchyma|soil warming|structure-function relationship|tracheid lumen size|tree-ring anatomy
